title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Chehalis Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Chehalis Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Untitled (County Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- Any communications with Adam Mosher of a company called Cybercheck AI or Global Intelligence Inc 
- Any memos, contracts, MOUs, or internal communications or emails referencing Adam 
Mosher, Mosher, Cybercheck AI or CyberDNA
- documentation for CyberDNA or Cybercheck AI
- emails to representatives of Cybercheck ai (@cybercheck.ai) please include any attachments.
-any reports produced by Cybercheck AI or its software

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

We will get you the information as quickly as we can.

Thank you.

 <https://www.dropbox.com/> 

Setup required: Dropbox folders automatically sync across your devices 
Here's access to your very own Dropbox folders. Click below to get started. 
Continue <https://www.dropbox.com/h> 

Here are some ways to use Dropbox: 
 * Back up your files—like photos and important docs—to keep them stored 
safely. 
 * Download Dropbox <http://www.dropbox.com/downloading> on your devices to 
access files from wherever you are. 
 * Send larger files and folders to clients and friends with
Dropbox Transfer <http://www.dropbox.com/transfer>—even if they don’t use 
Dropbox.  Out of storage space? No problem. We’ll give you an additional 250 MB 
<http://www.dropbox.com/gs>* for free once you complete a few steps.

* This page can only be viewed from a computer, not a mobile phone.

communications.subject: Hello Dhruv, you can easily & securely request files from others with Dropbox
communications.communication:

‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

 <https://www.dropbox.com/> 


File sharing just got an upgrade 

Hi Dhruv, 

Any changes made to a shared file will be automatically updated and synced for 
all recipients. 

Click to view your Dropbox <https://www.dropbox.com/h> 

Give others a preview with view-only access
Want someone to be able to see your files but not be able to edit them? Share 
your content with view-only access.

Collaborate using edit access
Need others to collaborate on content with you? You can give them edit access 
to entire folders or specific files.

Collect content with a File Request
Dropbox's File Request feature lets you easily & securely request files from 
others– whether they have a Dropbox account or not.

Learn more 
<https://help.dropbox.com/guide/individual/how-to-share-files-folders#sharing-with-dropbox>

title: California Police and Immigration (San Diego Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting records and data related to Senate Bill 674. The law requires certifying agencies that receive certification requests must annually report to the Legislature the number of victims that requested certifications from the particular agency, the number of certifications signed, and the number of certifications denied. The certifications are for U and T Visas. 

I am requesting 
- The annual reports sent to the legislature as legally required since 2018. 
- Department U visa certification policy and protocols since 2024
- Bulletins, emails, memos, directives, or any communications from DHS and/or United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) regarding SB674 and Form I-914s. Search January 2025 to today's date. 
- Any memos, bulletins, directives, or formal communications regarding U and T Visas. Search from 2020 to today's date. 

Thank you!

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: California Police and Immigration (San Diego Police Department)
communications.communication:
Adding to my request below: Please include denial letters since 2018

Hello,

I am requesting records and data related to Senate Bill 674. The law requires certifying agencies that receive certification requests must annually report to the Legislature the number of victims that requested certifications from the particular agency, the number of certifications signed, and the number of certifications denied. The certifications are for U and T Visas.

I am requesting
- The annual reports sent to the legislature as legally required since 2018.
- Department U visa certification policy and protocols since 2024
- Bulletins, emails, memos, directives, or any communications from DHS and/or United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) regarding SB674 and Form I-914s. Search January 2025 to today's date.
- Any memos, bulletins, directives, or formal communications regarding U and T Visas. Search from 2020 to today's date.

Thank you!

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

City of San Diego ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-2953: Good afternoon, Additional responsive records were provided in a previous request at the following link: https://sandiego.nextrequest.com/requests/22-1799. title: Safety National Complaints (Attorney General's Office)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Safety National Complaints (Attorney General's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all records in your possession from January 1, 2014, through the present concerning complaints, investigations, or regulatory actions involving Safety National Casualty Corporation, including any affiliated entities such as Safety Specialty Insurance Company and Sedgwick Claims Management Services, Inc. 

Specifically, I request copies of all consumer complaints alleging claim denials, delays, bad faith practices, misrepresentation of coverage, or failure to defend or indemnify insureds; any related correspondence or internal assessments; all regulatory enforcement actions, including market conduct examinations, administrative penalties, consent orders, fines, stipulations, or notices of violation; and any internal memoranda, emails, audit findings, or documentation regarding systemic or repeated misconduct. I also seek any statistical reports, dashboards, or complaint trend summaries reflecting activity related to Safety National during this period.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Fecteau

communications.subject: Records Request submitted to the Massachusetts Attorney General’s Office

Please remember:  If you submit a request on a weekend or legal holiday it will be received the next business day; otherwise your request is received on the day you submit it.

title: Rutgers transgender inmate care

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Rutgers transgender inmate care
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

University Correctional Health Care policy and guidance documents regarding the care and treatment of transgender inmates from the New Jersey Department of Corrections. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The exact number of people who are 

1) on both the sex offender registry and probation; and
2) on both the sex offender registry and parole;

as per the latest available data is requested.

If this cannot be provided, I request records that include:

The list of people on probation
The list of people on parole
The list of people on the sex offender registry

as per the latest available data. 

If this data is held by another agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

communications.subject: RE: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision Request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Your request was received and is being processed. Your request was submitted after business hours on June 5, 2025 and received by the Department the following business day, June 6, 2025. The Department has five business days upon receipt of a request to issue a response. Pursuant to KRS 197.025, KRS 61.870 to 61.884 to the contrary notwithstanding, , the department shall respond to the request within five (5) days after receipt of the request, excepting Saturdays, Sundays, and legal holidays, and state whether the record may be inspected or may not be inspected, or that the record is unavailable and when the record is expected to be available.

Thank you,

Keesha Solomon
Open Records Coordinator | Division of Public Affairs
Kentucky Department of Corrections

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III."

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

View request history, upload responsive documents, and report problems here:
https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fnew-mexico-educational-retirement-board-9714%252Fwater-asset-management-funds-correspondence-147140%252F%253Femail%253DERB-IPRARequests%252540state.nm.us&url_auth_token=AAAejVoj7mUzQuvZTrQzIiMXR0o%3A1q6K2f%3AKidGUukSc_O7YsTqva9di2T2N5M7l7X6hasShQQebS0

If prompted for a passcode, please enter:
YKCXUERV

Filed via MuckRock.com
E-mail (Preferred): 147140-15493170@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:147140-15493170@requests.muckrock.com>

PLEASE NOTE OUR NEW ADDRESS
For mailed responses, please address (see note):
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 147140
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

PLEASE NOTE: This request was filed by a MuckRock staff reporter. Also note that improperly addressed (i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for your response! My name is Rebecca Burns and my colleague Julia Rock and I are reporters at The Lever, a national investigative outlet. I am making this request as part of ongoing reporting into water issues in the American West. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

title: Request for Body Camera Footage and Incident Records – Feb 2, 2025 I-35 Chase (Bell County & Troy PD) (Lorena Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Body Camera Footage and Incident Records – Feb 2, 2025 I-35 Chase (Bell County & Troy PD) (Lorena Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the high-speed pursuit and arrests that occurred on February 2, 2025, beginning around 12:30 a.m. on Interstate 35 near the 310-mile marker in Troy, Texas. The incident involved two four-door vehicles reportedly traveling at 108 MPH. The first vehicle attempted to exit and re-enter the highway multiple times, then tried to drive northbound in the southbound lanes near Industrial Boulevard in Temple. Troy Police reportedly forced the vehicle off the road, and three suspects were arrested after a foot pursuit. Weapons and drugs were reportedly recovered.

Please include:

Body camera footage from Troy PD, Bell County SO, Temple PD, and Lorena PD

Dashcam video from all police units involved in the pursuit and apprehension

911 call audio and radio dispatch logs from the incident

Incident and arrest reports, including affidavits, if available

Any photos, drone, or scene video footage

Any use of force documentation (if applicable)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Detailing/hiring arrangements for Jeremy Lewin (United States Agency for International Development)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Detailing/hiring arrangements for Jeremy Lewin (United States Agency for International Development)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In a sworn declaration in J. Doe 1-26 vs. Musk (https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.mdd.576293/gov.uscourts.mdd.576293.77.2.pdf), Jeremy Lewin stated that he has been employed at USAID since 1/28/2025 as a Senior Advisor. He also declares he has never worked for Elon Musk or the USDS. Jeremy Lewin was also among the initial team of DOGE staffers that arrived at the CFPB on or around 2/6/2025. He was also identified as being on the staff list at the National Institute of Health along with other identified DOGE staffer in an article published in Wired on 2/24/2025. I would like to request the following information where possible:

For USAID:
1. Any confirmation that Jeremy Lewin was formally hired at USAID on or before 1/28/2025
2. If Jeremy Lewin was detailed to the USAID from another agency, any relevant details on that arrangement that you can share, including a memorandum of understanding (or similar document) outlining his duties and responsibilities of each partner, as well as emails between the USAID and the other agency about the arrangement. I would expect this to be on our around Feb 6, 2025

For the CFPB and possibly USAID:
3. If Jeremy Lewin was hired by the CFPB, any details you can share on that appointment, including if he signed the relevant onboarding paperwork as a new hire at the agency. I would expect this to be on or around February 6, 2025
4. If Jeremy Lewin was detailed to the CFPB from another agency, any relevant details that can be shared on the memorandum of understanding (or similar documents) outlining his role and the responsibilities of each partner in this arrangement, as well as emails about the detailing arrangements where available in either USAID/State or the CFPB. I would expect these communication to be on or around February 6, 2025

For NIH and possibly USAID/CFPB:
5. If Jeremy Lewin was detailed to the National Institute of Health from the USAID or CFPB, I would like to request the corresponding memorandum of understanding or other relevant documents about that arrangement, as well as any relevant email communications you can provide from any other agency to the National Institutes of Health about that arrangement. I do not have a precise date for this, but I would expect it to be in February 2025 before 2/24/2025

For US Doge Service:
1. If you have any records that show that Jeremy Lewin was hired as an employee of USDS at any time in January or February 2025, I would appreciate that.
2. Any communications between the USDS and other agencies (USAID/Department of State) coordinating the detailing of Jeremy Lewin to agencies like the CFPB alongside other staff employed by USDS

I understand that you might not be able to provide me some agency-internal personnel records under FOIA exemptions 2 and 6, but I think it is in the public interest to understand the coordination among these agencies, and I would hope you would be able to provide me whatever relevant details can help provide more insight on what was being done in these partnerships. Please reach out if you need any clarification or want to give me feedback on my requests. Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Harris

communications.subject: USAID FOIA No. F-00736-25 (Acknowledgment Letter)
communications.communication:
May 06, 2025 RE:  USAID FOIA No. F-00736-25 (Acknowledgment Letter) Dear Mr. Harris: Thank you for your letter dated March 25, 2025, requesting information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. §  552.  The tracking number for your request is F-00736-25.  Please use this number when corresponding with our office. At this time, we are in the process of perfecting your request.  A perfected request for records reasonably describes such records and is made in accordance with published rules stating the time, place, fees (if any) and procedures to be followed.  This process includes reviewing the request for clarity and fee category determination and related commitment to pay, if applicable. Once your request is perfected, you will be notified of the FOIA Specialist assigned to process your case.  If you have questions, please contact us at .  Please cite the above-referenced number when corresponding with our office. (mailto:foia@usaid.gov) foia@usaid.gov Thank you. Sincerely, Sophia Williams 
FOIA Specialist 
Bureau for Management 
Office of Management Services 
Information and Records Division

communications.subject: USAID FOIA REQUEST No. F-00736-25 (FOIA Specialist Assignment Email)
communications.communication:
May 06, 2025 Re: USAID FOIA Request No. F-00736-25 (FOIA Specialist Assignment Email) Dear Mr.  Harris: This acknowledges receipt of your March 25, 2025 , Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the United States Agency for International Development (USAID). Specifically, you requested USAID:1. Any confirmation that Jeremy Lewin was formally hired at USAID on or before 1/28/20252. If Jeremy Lewin was detailed to the USAID from another agency, any relevant details on that arrangement that you can share, including a memorandum of understanding (or similar document) outlining his duties and responsibilities of each partner, as well as emails between the USAID and the other agency about the arrangement. I would expect this to be on our around Feb 6, 2025For the CFPB and possibly USAID:3. If Jeremy Lewin was hired by the CFPB, any details you can share on that appointment, including if he signed the relevant onboarding paperwork as a new hire at the agency. I would expect this to be on or around February 6, 20254. If Jeremy Lewin was detailed to the CFPB from another agency, any relevant details that can be shared on the memorandum of understanding (or similar documents) outlining his role and the responsibilities of each partner in this arrangement, as well as emails about the detailing arrangements where available in either USAID/State or the CFPB. I would expect these communication to be on or around February 6, 2025For NIH and possibly USAID/CFPB:5. If Jeremy Lewin was detailed to the National Institute of Health from the USAID or CFPB, I would like to request the corresponding memorandum of understanding or other relevant documents about that arrangement, as well as any relevant email communications you can provide from any other agency to the National Institutes of Health about that arrangement. I do not have a precise date for this, but I would expect it to be in February 2025 before 2/24/2025For US Doge Service:1. If you have any records that show that Jeremy Lewin was hired as an employee of USDS at any time in January or February 2025, I would appreciate that.2. Any communications between the USDS and other agencies (USAID/Department of State) coordinating the detailing of Jeremy Lewin to agencies like the CFPB alongside other staff employed by USDS. FOIA Specialist our request has been assigned to Pamela Arrington, FOIA Specialist.  You may contact Pamela Arrington by email at parringtoncampbell@usaid.gov or by phone on 202-921-5010.  Please reference the tracking number cited above in any future correspondence. Extending the FOIA’s Time Limits due to Unusual Circumstances The FOIA provides that an agency  may extend its time limits when “unusual circumstances” occur in the processing of a request. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B)(i) (2016).  Those “unusual circumstances” are set forth in the statute, 5 U.S.C § 552(a)(6)(B)(iii), and are described as: 1) The need to search for records from field facilities or other locations separate from the office processing the request; 2) The need to search, collect and examine voluminous records; and 3) The need for consultation with another agency. Based upon the records you have requested, we have determined that one or more unusual circumstances will occur during the processing of your request.  Accordingly, your response time-limit has been extended beyond the 20 days required by statute; therefore, 10 additional processing days have been added to your request. To mitigate this action, you may limit the scope of the request so that it can be processed more quickly or to arrange an alternative time to respond. 
lease note, as reported by various public sources and acknowledged across federal service channels, USAID is undergoing a broad realignment of programs and responsibilities. These shifts, coupled with reduced staffing levels and increasing litigation demands, have significantly impacted our FOIA processing capacity. If you have any questions or wish to discuss reformulation or an alternative time frame for the processing of your request, you may contact the assigned FOIA Specialist noted above. You may also contact USAID’s FOIA Public Liaison, Christopher Colbow, at foia@usaid.gov (mailto:foia@usaid.gov) . 

Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services offered: Office of Government Information Services National Archives and Records Administration 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001 E-mail: ogis@nara.gov Telephone: 202-741-5770; Toll Free: 1-877-684-6448 Fax: 202-741-5769 Thank you for your interest in USAID. Sincerely, 
Sophia Williams 
FOIA Specialist 
Bureau for Management 
Office of Management Services 
Information and Records Division

title: Public Records Request - Alachua

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Alachua
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the BODY CAMERA worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:
https://alachuachronicle.com/alachua-woman-charged-with-dui-fleeing-and-battery-on-law-enforcement-officer/

Exact date of incident: September 18, 2024
Names of parties involved: Dawn Marie Burkhardt

I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.

I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.

Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.


Best regards,
George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

title: Nikolai Khokhlov

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Nikolai Khokhlov
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to, mentioning, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Nikolai Evgenievich Khokhlov (June 7, 1922 - September 17, 2007), a KGB officer who defected to the United States in 1954. (Obituary: https://www.hsir.org/Annals_en/E2d030khokhlov.pdf)

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1513602-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 111 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 895 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,929 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Public Records Request: ShotSpotter Grant

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request: ShotSpotter Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a story published on August 18, the Tacoma Police Department received a $800,000 grant from the Department of Justice's Bureau of Justice Assistance to pilot the use of ShotSpotter.

Source: https://www.thenewstribune.com/news/local/crime/article291124000.html

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, budgets, grant narratives and reporting documents for the $800,000 Department of Justice Bureau of Justice Assistance grant received to pilot ShotSpotter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Tacoma's Public Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear e e, 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Tacoma's Public Records Center! 
 
Your Login ID is:  175680-34001146@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://tacoma.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx) 
 
Please login to "My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. 
 
City of Tacoma This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, budgets, grant narratives and reporting documents for the $800,000 Department of Justice Bureau of Justice Assistance grant received to pilot ShotSpotter. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ftacoma-police-department-734%252Fpublic-records-request-shotspotter-grant-175680%252F%253Femail%253Dpdr%252540cityoftacoma.org&url_auth_token=AAAbe42lYv9sJH3bFfCisAF6Sr4%3A1t7zNM%3ABgbP-5UtQtnUe2CIGddvbwECXTDY0AZPn9rBqbGUmnA” 
Responsive records to your request have been compiled.  

All records responsive to your request have been produced and, therefore, your request is fulfilled and closed as of the date of this letter.  The City does not intend to further address your request and the one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review begins to run as of the date of this letter. 
Thank you for allowing us to assist you.  Please contact me within 30 days of this letter July 12,2025, if you have any questions. 

Regards, 

Chan  Reiter 
Public Disclosure Analyst 
Public Records Office 
(253) 231-0241

title: ALPR Audit (St. Charles County Police Department)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: ALPR Audit (St. Charles County Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: ALPR Audit (St. Charles County Police Department)
communications.communication:
Hello Scott,

We’ve received your request. I just returned from being out of town all last week. I have forwarded your request to our Records Department Supervisor and she will be responding to your request.



Let me know if you have any further questions.



Corporal Barry Bayles



Barry Bayles
Public Information Officer
3057

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: ALPR Audit (St. Charles County Police Department)
communications.communication:
Mr. Kampas,

We have received your records request. We will research your request and follow up with any estimated costs and time frames. We appreciate your patience.

For future requests, please contact records@sccmo.org<mailto:records@sccmo.org>. Corporal Bayles is our Public Information Officer but does not handle any records requests.



PD_OPS

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Information Involving  Arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" (9/23/2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all police and arrest reports related to the traffic stop and subsequent arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" for OUI charges on or around September 23, 2022. The Charge Case Number is "22-664-AR".

Any mugshot photo related to the arrest of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

All body-worn camera footage recorded by any Westbrook Police Department personnel during the initial stop, field sobriety testing, detention, arrest, and transport of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

All dash camera footage from any patrol vehicles involved in the stop, detention, or transport of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident.

If portions of the requested footage are exempt or confidential, please produce the non-exempt portions and cite the specific legal exemptions justifying any withholding or redaction.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Brass

title: Data on school-based arrests (Seekonk Police Department)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Data on school-based arrests (Seekonk Police Department)
communications.communication:
To whoever it may concern:  
  

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department. 

Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.  

A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”  

A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”  

  

I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):  

  

1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns:  

a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement  

b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement  

c. Charge (or charges)  

d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement  

e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school. 

k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and  

l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.  

  

2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).  

  

3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).  

  

4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.  

  

5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).   

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”  

  

It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.  

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d).  

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety. 

If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.  

  

Sincerely,  

Katherine Stathulis

J.D. Research Fellow

Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration 

Northeastern University School of Law

k.stathulis@northeastern.edu
  
617-373-5862

title: Untitled (Department of Justice, Office of Information Policy)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled (Department of Justice, Office of Information Policy)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Greetings. I request copies of any memos, studies, or other such records dated Jan 1, 2020, through the date you complete your search, referencing (1) the Justice Department resources spent or expected to be spent litigating Freedom of Information Act cases or (2) the frequency with which the government has won or lost Freedom of Information Act cases.  I'm not looking for individual emails that happen to make mention of these subjects, but rather, more formal studies or other such records that are the results of a more formal evaluation.  I'm happy to discuss the scope with you.  By "resources" I mean the costs in terms of attorney/staff hours, FTEs, or salaries.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Topic

title: ALPR Audit (Madison County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: ALPR Audit (Madison County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas

title: South Carolina SEA response

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: South Carolina SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the South Carolina Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: Research Data Request :: D001739-050125
communications.communication:
Dear Ileana Garnand: 
Thank you for submitting a records request to the South Carolina Department of Education (SCDE) to be processed under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Your request was received on May 01, 2025, and is being processed in accordance with S.C. Code Ann. § 30-4-10. Your request has been assigned the reference number D001739-050125 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the South Carolina Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

Attachments:

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/ileanagarnand/156023/3.28.25_Cover_letter_and_annual_notice_re_FERPA_002.pdf
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-education-6442%252Fsouth-carolina-sea-response-185934%252F%253Femail%253Dfoia%252540ed.sc.gov&url_auth_token=AAA45y96mfQeDconPmc1alpcLkU%3A1uAfhh%3AuxNX1MZJ6s-ZAhO_ZAO9X3CuyELTamMkfXSUl_sEZPM 
The SCDE has 10 business days within which to inform you of the availability of the non-exempt “public records” that you have requested and to provide a time and cost estimate to make available those public records to you. For records more than 24 months old, the agency has 20 business days to respond on availability and cost. We do not guarantee that a records search will result in any responsive records being located. 
Please note that it is against South Carolina law to obtain or use personal information from public records for commercial solicitation. S.C. Code Ann. § 30-2-30 and -50. That law defines “personal information” as:  
[I]information that identifies or describes an individual including, but not limited to, an individual's photograph or digitized image, social security number, date of birth, driver's identification number, name, home address, home telephone number, medical or disability information, education level, financial status, bank account numbers, account or identification number issued by or used, or both, by any federal or state governmental agency or private financial institution, employment history, height, weight, race, other physical details, signature, biometric identifiers, and any credit records or reports. 
There are criminal penalties involved for noncompliance with the state’s prohibitions against using information secured through a FOIA records request for commercial solicitation. 
We do not make public, and will not produce in response to your request, those records that may be exempted under state law, including, but not limited to, trade secrets, personal information of students, confidential proprietary information, privileged communications, or protected information. We do not provide personally identifiable student or educator information. For a partial list of exemptions under the law, please see S.C. Code Ann. § 30-4-40. Additionally, we abide by all laws and regulations pertaining to the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), and the S.C. Family Privacy Protection Act, and do not make public any records protected under these Acts. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the following link SCDE Public Records Center. You'll receive an e-mail when availability and cost have been determined. 
Sincerely, 
The South Carolina Department of Education

Your request is being processed in accordance with S.C. Code Ann. § 30-4-10. The SCDE has 10 business days within which to inform you of the availability of the non-exempt “public records” that you have requested and to provide a time and cost estimate to make available those public records to you. For records more than 24 months old, the agency has 20 business days to respond on availability and cost. We do not guarantee that a records search will result in any responsive records being located. Please note that it is against South Carolina law to obtain or use personal information from public records for commercial solicitation. S.C. Code Ann. § 30-2-30 and -50. That law defines “personal information” as: [I]information that identifies or describes an individual including, but not limited to, an individual's photograph or digitized image, social security number, date of birth, driver's identification number, name, home address, home telephone number, medical or disability information, education level, financial status, bank account numbers, account or identification number issued by or used, or both, by any federal or state governmental agency or private financial institution, employment history, height, weight, race, other physical details, signature, biometric identifiers, and any credit records or reports. There are criminal penalties involved for noncompliance with the state’s prohibitions against using information secured through a FOIA records request for commercial solicitation. We do not make public, and will not produce in response to your request, those records that may be exempted under state law, including, but not limited to, trade secrets, personal information of students, confidential proprietary information, privileged communications, or protected information. We do not provide personally identifiable student or educator information. For a partial list of exemptions under the law, please see S.C. Code Ann. § 30-4-40. Additionally, we abide by all laws and regulations pertaining to the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), and the S.C. Family Privacy Protection Act, and do not make public any records protected under these Acts. You can monitor the progress of your request through our records request portal. You'll receive an e-mail when availability and cost have been determined. Sincerely, FOIA Officer South Carolina Department of Education As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the South Carolina Department of Education portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the South Carolina Department of Education through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact South Carolina Department of Education.

communications.communication:
South Carolina Department of Education ************************************************************************ Record request #25-107 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Dear Requestor, The South Carolina Department of Education (SCDE) received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request. Please note that it is against South Carolina law to obtain or use personal information from public records for commercial solicitation. S.C. Code Ann. § 30-2-30 and -50. That law defines “personal information” as: [I]information that identifies or describes an individual including, but not limited to, an individual's photograph or digitized image, social security number, date of birth, driver's identification number, name, home address, home telephone number, medical or disability information, education level, financial status, bank account numbers, account or identification number issued by or used, or both, by any federal or state governmental agency or private financial institution, employment history, height, weight, race, other physical details, signature, biometric identifiers, and any credit records or reports. There are criminal penalties involved for noncompliance with the state’s prohibitions against using information secured through a FOIA records request for commercial solicitation.  We do not make public, and will not produce in response to your request, those records that may be exempted under state law, including, but not limited to, trade secrets, personal information of students, confidential proprietary information, privileged communications, or protected information. We do not provide personally identifiable student or educator information. For a partial list of exemptions under the law, please see S.C. Code Ann. § 30-4-40. Additionally, we abide by all laws and regulations pertaining to the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), and the S.C. Family Privacy Protection Act, and do not make public any records protected under these Acts. In regards to your request, please visit the portal to download the nonexempt requested records.  We have responded under the FOIA within the timelines required and provided you with the nonexempted, requested information. Your FOIA request has been met and it is now closed. If you have any further questions, please respond to this email. Sincerely, FOIA Officer South Carolina Department of Education ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? title: 2018 Crime Incident Records Request (Pasadena Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: 2018 Crime Incident Records Request (Pasadena Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2018
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block
