title: DPS Policies and Guidance on PTSA, Volunteers, and Third-Party Program Oversight

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: DPS Policies and Guidance on PTSA, Volunteers, and Third-Party Program Oversight
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to the following public records under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), § 24-72-201 et seq., C.R.S., covering the period from August 1, 2024, through the date this request is received. These records relate to internal Denver Public Schools (DPS) documentation, policy, training, and oversight practices concerning volunteer conduct, PTA/PTSA programs, and third-party liability or risk management on DPS campuses.

This request includes relevant historical documentation necessary to evaluate DPS’s policies and oversight practices, including any prior incidents or district-level assessments that inform current procedures.

Requested Records: 
All internal DPS records, materials, and documentation—including but not limited to policies, training materials, legal guidance, reference documents, written procedures, risk memos, internal reviews, or official evaluations that reference or relate to:

- Oversight, accountability, and risk management for PTA/PTSA-run activities or programs operating on DPS campuses
- Expectations for volunteer conduct, enforcement mechanisms, and any “Adult Code of Conduct” policies, especially as applied to third-party or PTA-affiliated adults
- DPS responsibility for safety, supervision, or liability in relation to PTA/PTSA programs or other non-DPS activities involving students, parents, or volunteers
- Guidance or directives provided to school leaders (including principals) for managing third-party, PTA-run, or volunteer-led programs
- Any discussion or interpretation of DPS Board Policy KFA and its applicability to non-DPS programs (including PTSA) operating on DPS campuses
- Internal guidance or materials related to responding to complaints, defamation, or reputational harm involving volunteers or community members
- DPS’s stated or interpreted responsibility for managing adult behavior, safety, and legal exposure on school campuses in connection with non-employee adults

For the period August 1, 2022 to present: Any documentation, communications, or internal evaluations related to PTA/PTSA-run programs at DPS schools that involved complaints, safety concerns, policy violations, or adult misconduct—particularly where DPS personnel played a role in oversight, response, complaint resolution, or risk assessment

If applicable, include any materials shared with or developed by:
- School principals or other administrative staff (including Centennial Principal Volkert)
- DPS Operational Services staff (including Director Scott Wolf)
- DPS Human Resources personnel
- Legal or Risk Management personnel
- School PTAs or PTSAs
- Family and Community Engagement (FACE) Office
- Volunteer Services or other departments responsible for volunteer programs

This request excludes general internal communications (such as emails, chats, or text messages), which are covered under a separate CORA request submitted concurrently (“DPS Internal Records on PTSA Incidents – Centennial Oct 2024 & Mar 2025”). However, if any such communications are attached to or embedded within formal documentation—such as policies, training materials, legal reviews, or procedural guidance—they should be included in the responsive records for this request.

If any portion of this request yields no responsive records, I respectfully request that you state that explicitly. If any documents are withheld, please provide the specific legal basis for denial (including citation to the relevant CORA exemption) and a general description of the material being withheld as required under § 24-72-204(3)(a), C.R.S.

Please notify me if clarification or narrowing would expedite fulfillment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Patrick Quigley

communications.subject: Welcome to the CORA Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Patrick  Quigley, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Denver Public Schools CORA Request Center.

communications.subject: CORA Records Request :: R000525-052225
communications.communication:
Dear Patrick Quigley: 

Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 5/22/2025 and given the reference number R000525-052225 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to the following public records under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), § 24-72-201 et seq., C.R.S., covering the period from August 1, 2024, through the date this request is received. These records relate to internal Denver Public Schools (DPS) documentation, policy, training, and oversight practices concerning volunteer conduct, PTA/PTSA programs, and third-party liability or risk management on DPS campuses.

This request includes relevant historical documentation necessary to evaluate DPS’s policies and oversight practices, including any prior incidents or district-level assessments that inform current procedures.

Requested Records:
All internal DPS records, materials, and documentation—including but not limited to policies, training materials, legal guidance, reference documents, written procedures, risk memos, internal reviews, or official evaluations that reference or relate to:

- Oversight, accountability, and risk management for PTA/PTSA-run activities or programs operating on DPS campuses
- Expectations for volunteer conduct, enforcement mechanisms, and any “Adult Code of Conduct” policies, especially as applied to third-party or PTA-affiliated adults
- DPS responsibility for safety, supervision, or liability in relation to PTA/PTSA programs or other non-DPS activities involving students, parents, or volunteers
- Guidance or directives provided to school leaders (including principals) for managing third-party, PTA-run, or volunteer-led programs
- Any discussion or interpretation of DPS Board Policy KFA and its applicability to non-DPS programs (including PTSA) operating on DPS campuses
- Internal guidance or materials related to responding to complaints, defamation, or reputational harm involving volunteers or community members
- DPS’s stated or interpreted responsibility for managing adult behavior, safety, and legal exposure on school campuses in connection with non-employee adults

For the period August 1, 2022 to present: Any documentation, communications, or internal evaluations related to PTA/PTSA-run programs at DPS schools that involved complaints, safety concerns, policy violations, or adult misconduct—particularly where DPS personnel played a role in oversight, response, complaint resolution, or risk assessment

If applicable, include any materials shared with or developed by:
- School principals or other administrative staff (including Centennial Principal Volkert)
- DPS Operational Services staff (including Director Scott Wolf)
- DPS Human Resources personnel
- Legal or Risk Management personnel
- School PTAs or PTSAs
- Family and Community Engagement (FACE) Office
- Volunteer Services or other departments responsible for volunteer programs

This request excludes general internal communications (such as emails, chats, or text messages), which are covered under a separate CORA request submitted concurrently (“DPS Internal Records on PTSA Incidents – Centennial Oct 2024 & Mar 2025”). However, if any such communications are attached to or embedded within formal documentation—such as policies, training materials, legal reviews, or procedural guidance—they should be included in the responsive records for this request.

If any portion of this request yields no responsive records, I respectfully request that you state that explicitly. If any documents are withheld, please provide the specific legal basis for denial (including citation to the relevant CORA exemption) and a general description of the material being withheld as required under § 24-72-204(3)(a), C.R.S.

Please notify me if clarification or narrowing would expedite fulfillment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Patrick Quigley

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdenver-public-schools-5864%252Fdps-policies-and-guidance-on-ptsa-volunteers-and-third-party-program-oversight-186899%252F%253Femail%253Dcora%252540dpsk12.org&url_auth_token=AABOPpm91UsBl8ajB5vAZ7tBzJg%3A1uIKBx%3AtV5A2f7kcPyhd_bpXLM1i42b0kIajO7uvrq3pTDdp3E 

The Colorado Open Records Act requires a response within three business days (excludes holidays, closures and weekends). The three‐day timeline begins on the first business day following the receipt of the request.  Multiple requests in one email will be treated as one request for reimbursement purposes.  The district may also treat multiple requests concerning the same subject matter as one request.  The process is as follows: 
 
  * The CORA Officer will review your request and work with staff to determine: 
 
  * If the district is the custodian of the requested documents; 
  * How much staff time will be required to retrieve the documents (please note the below reimbursement policy for requests requiring more than one hour of staff time); and 
  * If an extension is necessary 
 
  * If applicable, within three business days of the receipt of the request, the CORA lead with notify you of the cost of your request and any extension needed to respond to your request. 
  * The CORA Officer will provide a final response to your request in accordance with the applicable CORA timeline after payment is received (as applicable). Please note: The Colorado Open Records Act only makes available public records that already exist. It does not require the creation of new records to respond to a request. It also does not require the district to manipulate or analyze existing information in a new way to respond to a request. CORA Reimbursement Policy ‐ 
The Colorado Open Records Act allows for the following reimbursement for reasonable costs associated with completing a request: 
 
  * Copying Expenses: We charge $0.25 for each hard‐copy page after the first 25 pages. 
  * Staff Time: For requests that require more than one hour of staff time, we charge $41.37 for each additional hour of staff time expended. 
  * There will be a retrieval charge for documents stored at an offsite facility, dependent on the number of boxes to be retrieved. 
  * Electronically stored files which are larger than 14MB will be transferred to a CD for a charge of $10 per CD. 
You can read more about the District’s CORA Policy 
You can monitor the progress of your request here. here.  You will receive an email when your request has been completed.

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request #R000525-052225
communications.communication:
Ms. Wheeler,

Thank you for your message. I am providing the requested clarification below.

To clarify, this request does not seek standalone emails or chats; those are addressed under a separate request titled “DPS Internal Records on PTSA Incidents – Centennial (Oct 2024 & Mar 2025)”.

This request seeks formal, published, or institutional records in the possession of DPS that relate to the district’s internal oversight, policies, training, or risk evaluation processes for non-DPS or volunteer-run programs (e.g., PTA/PTSA) operating on DPS campuses.

Requested Records Include:

A. Current Policies, Guidance, and Risk Materials
(Timeframe: August 1, 2024 – Present)
- Board policies, governance manuals, procedural directives, or internal guidance specifically related to volunteers, PTA/PTSA, or other third-party programs operating on DPS campuses, including any references to Board Policy KFA or related liability or oversight concerns
- Training materials, staff slide decks, handouts, or onboarding checklists provided to principals, HR, Operational Services, or site-based staff regarding oversight of PTA/PTSA, volunteer, or other non-DPS programs
- Formal memoranda, policy advisories, or bulletins issued by HR, Risk Management, FACE, Operational Services, or Legal concerning:
          - Volunteer conduct and supervision
          - Incident escalation and documentation
          - Risk management or liability protocols for third-party programs
- Internal legal guidance, risk-management analysis, or “lessons learned” documents relating to incidents involving volunteer-run or non-DPS programs
- Guidance, protocols, or legal advisories on responding to potentially defamatory, libelous, or reputationally damaging public claims involving volunteers or community members

B. Historical PTSA-Related Incident Reviews
(Timeframe: August 1, 2022 – Present)
Documentation, internal evaluations, or formal reviews involving PTA/PTSA-run programs that raised complaints, safety concerns, policy violations, or adult misconduct—particularly where DPS personnel played a role in oversight, response, complaint resolution, or risk assessment

Please let me know if this scope is clear or needs further narrowing.
Thank you,
Patrick Quigley

title: Requesting MCAS tests and items (Department of Education)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Requesting MCAS tests and items (Department of Education)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all MCAS tests and items administered since its inception in 1993, organized by subject, grade level, and date of administration, *including* whether those items were used as part of test or MCAS re-test/re-take.

This material is being request for an educational purpose, specifically the analysis and exploration of test composition over time as part of a high school's education mission.

The Public Records Law requires you to provide me with a written response within 10 business days. If you cannot comply with my request, you are statutorily required to provide an explanation in writing.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alec Resnick

title: Palestine Protests

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Palestine Protests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Email communications sent or received by any employee or contractor of the California Highway Patrol which mentions "Palestine", "Palestinian", or "Gaza" between April 15th and the date on which this request is processed, excluding news articles.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Craig Neef

communications.communication:

RE: CPRA REQUEST of May 19, 2024, Reference # R003667-051924. Dear Mr. Neef, The California Highway Patrol received your request for records on May 19, 2024. The Public Records Unit (PRU) is determining whether you seek copies of disclosable public records in the Department’s possession.  Accordingly, the PRU is extending its 10-day response timeframe by an additional 14 days, as authorized by Government Code section 7922.535, subsection (c)(1). 

If you have any questions or need additional information, please respond to this email or contact the PRU at (916) 843-4030. 
Sincerely, 
Glory Coppage

title: Evergreen Solutions (Mohawk Valley Community College)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Mohawk Valley Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: FW: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Mohawk Valley Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom it May Concern:

On March 6, 2025 this office received your records request of March 6, 2025. In accordance with Article 6 of the New York Public Officers Law, please accept this letter as acknowledgement of our receipt of that request.

A determination will be made, and access to the requested records will be made as applicable, in accordance with Article 6 of the New York Public Officers Law and any other controlling statutes within 20 business days.  There may be a fee of $.25 per page for duplication of the records requested, or in certain circumstances, a document preparation fee if the records are delivered electronically.

If we are unable to determine the accessibility of the records, or are unable to compile and prepare the records within 20 days, you will be notified of the same and the date by which the request will be granted in whole or in part.


Thomas G. Squires, Vice President for Administrative Services
Mohawk Valley Community College

Hi Alisia,

Can you clarify what you mean by staff employees? I recognize that you are not looking for faculty. Are you looking for non-executive personnel only? And should that exclude classified employees? We can provide job descriptions which would also include grade once you clarify.

The "President's Report" included all titles for all full-time employees. The collective bargaining agreements we provided do have all salary grades for each of the unions. Crystal

title: American Correctional Association Accreditation/Audit Reports for Donald W. Wyatt Detention Facillity

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: American Correctional Association Accreditation/Audit Reports for Donald W. Wyatt Detention Facillity
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any reports produced from audits and/or accreditation reviews by the American Correctional Association for the Donald W. Wyatt Detention Facility, dating back to the facility's opening in 1993.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Philip Eil

title: Public Records Request for Bodycam Footage, Surveillance Video, Incident Reports, and Dashcam – Arrest of Elizar Ravelo (08/25/2023)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request for Bodycam Footage, Surveillance Video, Incident Reports, and Dashcam – Arrest of Elizar Ravelo (08/25/2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to the following records related to the arrest of Elizar Ravelo, 64, which occurred on August 25, 2023, in the morning at the McDonald's drive-thru, 4999 NW 36th St, Miami Springs, FL:

Body-worn camera footage from all officers involved in the response, investigation, or arrest of Elizar Ravelo.
Incident report(s) and arrest report(s) documenting this case.
Surveillance footage from McDonald’s or any business cameras obtained or reviewed by law enforcement regarding the incident.
In-car (dashcam) video from any patrol units that responded or were involved in transporting Mr. Ravelo.
Rear-seat police vehicle footage (if applicable) from the unit that transported Mr. Ravelo after his arrest.
As this incident occurred in a fast-food establishment with security cameras, surveillance footage is necessary for documenting the altercation and confirming the sequence of events. If any 911 calls exist, I request them only if they provide additional relevant details.

Fee Waiver Request
I request a fee waiver as the disclosure of these records serves the public interest in ensuring transparency in law enforcement actions and documenting public safety incidents, rather than for personal or commercial gain.

Please provide these records in digital format via email or a secure online portal if available. If any costs apply, please notify me before processing. If any portion of this request is denied or redacted, please cite the specific exemption under Florida law.

Thank you for your time and assistance. Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request for Bodycam Footage, Surveillance Video, Incident Reports, and Dashcam – Arrest of Elizar Ravelo (08/25/2023)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We are in receipt of your public records request. Your request will be processed in accordance with the Florida Public Records Law. It has been forwarded to the proper department(s) for retrieval of your requested records. Someone will be in contact with you as soon as possible with an estimate of copying and staff research charges (if applicable) or if any additional information is required.

Please feel free to contact the City Clerk’s Office at 305-805-5007 if you have any questions or concerns.

Best regards,

[cid:image001.jpg@01DB98AB.F65D97C0]<https://www.miamisprings-fl.gov/>
Juan D. Garcia, CMC, Deputy City Clerk
Office of the City Clerk
City of Miami Springs, FL
201 Westward Drive
Miami Springs, FL 33166
Phone: (305) 805-5007
garciaj@miamisprings-fl.gov<mailto:garciaj@miamisprings-fl.gov>

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Federal funding
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records showing the amount of Federal funding VMI received from 2021, delineated by agency, program, or other category(s) by which it is allocated or tracked.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Library Contract Request: Lexis Nexis (Nexis Uni) (University of Arizona)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Library Contract Request: Lexis Nexis (Nexis Uni) (University of Arizona)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with Lexis Nexis relating to the licensing of library database Nexis Uni; and

All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of library database Nexis Uni. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of library database Nexis Uni.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

mo

communications.subject: Your University of Arizona public records request #25-214 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
University of Arizona ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-214 has been submitted successfully. Hello, This email acknowledges receipt of your Public Records Request directed to the University of Arizona. Please refer to your public records request number when making inquiries regarding your request. Please note, the university's rates for fulfilling public records requests are as follows: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Non-commercial Requests Copying Fees: * * First 50 Pages: Free * Beyond 50 Pages: * Electronic Format: 20¢ per page (per side) * Black and White Paper Format: 25¢ per page (per side) * Oversize or Color Copies: Additional fees may apply if the reproduction cost exceeds 25¢ per page * Staff Time: $25.00 per hour, charged in quarter-hour increments, for document preparation ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Commercial Requests In addition to the copying fees mentioned above, commercial requests will incur extra fees, including: * * A portion of the cost to the University of Arizona for obtaining the original or copies of the records * A reasonable fee for the cost of equipment and personnel used in producing the record or reproduction * The value of the record or reproduction in the commercial market ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- If the Office of Public Records has enough information to move forward with the processing of your request, a preliminary estimate will be assessed utilizing the corresponding fee schedule(s) above. Once the estimate is crafted, the Office of Public Records will provide you with the corresponding estimate and will give you the opportunity to indicate if you would like to continue moving forward. Should you opt to accept the estimate and move forward, the Office of Public Records will continue to process the request, and once the records have been reviewed and finalized, a final invoice inclusive of the final costs will be provided to you for payment prior to disclosure. If any questions arise while you await the preliminary estimate, please don’t hesitate to reach out, thank you. As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the University of Arizona portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the University of Arizona through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact University of Arizona.

title: Public Records Request – Arrest of Iyanna Rollins at 2629 Academy Ave (June 18, 2022)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Arrest of Iyanna Rollins at 2629 Academy Ave (June 18, 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

On June 18, 2022, Iyanna Rollins, 18, was arrested by Volusia County Sheriff's Sgt. Chad Weaver at 2629 Academy Ave in Deltona, Florida. Weaver mistakenly responded to the wrong address for a burglary alarm and confronted Rollins as she was backing out of a driveway. The situation escalated quickly, and Rollins was charged with four felonies, including battery on a law enforcement officer. Bodycam footage was released following criticism on social media regarding the deputy’s conduct. In April 2023, Rollins’ attorney filed a motion to suppress evidence, citing Fourth Amendment violations.

I am requesting access to all records related to the arrest of Iyanna Rollins by Sgt. Chad Weaver on June 18, 2022, at or near 2629 Academy Avenue, Deltona, Florida:

All body-worn camera footage from Sgt. Chad Weaver and any other responding deputies.

Any dash camera footage from patrol vehicles involved in the incident.

Any rear seat camera footage from the vehicle in which Rollins was transported.

The full incident report, arrest report, and any supplemental or narrative reports.

Audio of dispatch communications or 911 calls related to the original burglary alarm.

Any internal communications or emails regarding the public release of the footage.

Any social media video or surveillance footage obtained or referenced by the Sheriff's Office.

If any additional records exist regarding the motion to suppress or internal discussion of the arrest controversy, I would also request those under this same request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with library vendor McGraw Hill relating to the licensing of the library database Access Medicine; and

All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of the library database Access Medicine; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of the library database Access Medicine.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of the library database Access Medicine.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

mo
Red Rocks Community College submission

1. Replying via the Records Center 
2. By responding to this email 
3. Calling the Reno Police Department Records Division at 775-334-2155 ext. 0 
4. By regular mail to: Reno Police Department PO Box 1900 Attn: Records Division Reno, NV 89505; or

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York Office of Cannabis Management 2022 and 2023 FOIL logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the log of all Freedom of Information Law requests made with your agency for calendar years 2022 and 2023. I ask that all fields — including the date, requester, description and disposition — are included.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

New York State Office of Cannabis Management

Under Public Officer’s Law you may appeal a FOIL determination. If you desire to submit an appeal, you must do so within 30 days of the written response to your FOIL request. Please include a copy of the original request for records, the FOIL Request Number, and a copy of the FOIL response letter you received along with your appeal letter to: Records Access Appeals Officer, Office of Cannabis Management, Harriman State Building, 1220 Washington Avenue, Building 9, 4th Floor, Albany, New York 12226.

communications.subject: [Records Center] FOIL Records Request :: R000460-022024
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
  
   
  
 
RE: FOIL Records Request of February 20, 2024, Reference # R000460-022024 
Dear Ben Welsh, 
The NYS Office of Cannabis Management received a FOIL request from you on February 20, 2024. Your requested: 
"To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

A copy of the log of all Freedom of Information Law requests made with your agency for calendar years 2022 and 2023. I ask that all fields — including the date, requester, description and disposition — are included. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Ben Welsh 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Foffice-of-cannabis-management-new-york-state-28865%252Fnew-york-office-of-cannabis-management-2022-and-2023-foil-logs-159025%252F%253Femail%253Dfoil%252540ocm.ny.gov&url_auth_token=AAEc6y3WeGE18Qvrc3pFp_f8uI8%3A1rccO3%3AKQGJ91V2O6jDhhjqj_eqKj25Mk_tGD8YWeMXDsdRKZQ" 
The NYS Office of Cannabis Management has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Please log in to the FOIL Records Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records. FOIL Records Request - R000460-022024 (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXU7-2FM4txsQHvcN-2FtukyxA3e3W-2BjqK6CH9gBNK24SlZ6YvFKuD-2BdqoZOX83Xfu3I5bANbdukzQ3LcBaZ4qGERLP4-3Dwe1x_OUmTwkF3yDM5HDAj5-2BBHgngy7saYZ-2Bq4JGFh1Hj891Ed7Ay-2FkjZkeV3fYRAZWPnKIdJcJwJnClTPh-2BaY8E2E9VkgFMEaeY-2BhvKWSAxaSHypYiFGGFvAQjHtZvZP1pQBKY4YR9igM3x2lXsKGaJtzwE7Mz0bzy-2FsrcXGdzBJTfwW-2Ba9-2FMNS1oL-2B-2Fw8ElE3qUBiYjG2FchhZ163NpS3jAdtHjMbJIdudpwiBhPCCZKoslE5FYYvf9CVG89OM1KMNvShUm-2FPDWeV7YslRdn7gpNNRrmnP9eBVriTAjl3QtaP1BNz2lMdfVAf18mnEAAMEREPaX-2BuLqhRwRVYvLRRBsVGKDdLco83EbDjCemu759gbAwgVeVseFFGYxuou8Dr9nq) 
Under Public Officers Law you may appeal a FOIL determination. If you desire to submit an appeal, you must do so within 30 days of the written response to your FOIL request according to the instructions on this website: https://cannabis.ny.gov/request-nys-office-cannabis-management-records-through-new-york-state-freedom-information-law. 
For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. 
Sincerely, 
Records Access Office 
Office of Cannabis Management 
 
Log into the FOIL Records Center to review or update this request. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXU7-2FM4txsQHvcN-2FtukyxA3fT2EaExTehnbxNImji8u0x1PBvQrHdehWGKaVBgqpB6RTu84k1WQzTCNp7xNrkFBg-3DmAxR_OUmTwkF3yDM5HDAj5-2BBHgngy7saYZ-2Bq4JGFh1Hj891Ed7Ay-2FkjZkeV3fYRAZWPnKIdJcJwJnClTPh-2BaY8E2E9VkgFMEaeY-2BhvKWSAxaSHypYiFGGFvAQjHtZvZP1pQBKY4YR9igM3x2lXsKGaJtzwE7Mz0bzy-2FsrcXGdzBJTfwW-2Ba9-2FMNS1oL-2B-2Fw8ElE3qUBiYjG2FchhZ163NpS3jAdtHjMbJIdudpwiBhPCCZKoslE5FYYvf9CVG89OM1KMNvSovGHxZUI13u3W7XnifbR8lY9y4MOOyBWrRy3N5mdXQ6iEGUxHNeAAjwK6mc0QzzvN05-2BwpktKtwDLanaPArhoPpS5SVpkDXxVtoqXd-2Bs6tLgFW6BVlWUTHjCEAPjdD6F)

title: Use of Force Policy (Tate County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Use of Force Policy (Tate County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All policies, practices, procedures, rules, or orders concerning the use of force.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Blake Feldman

I received your letter yesterday from my staff. When you asked for this information the old administration was still in office and must not have responded. We took over the office in January 2024. I will get you a copy of our Use of Force Policy as soon as I can.
Attached is a copy of the Tate County Sheriff's Office Use of Force policy that was requested

title: VMI Grants and Programs

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Grants and Programs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records on all grant programs, which also are defined and enumerated in the state budget, and through which SCHEV awards specific grants to institutions for specific purposes based on competitive application processes SCHEV adminsited for the Virginia Military Institute for the Period August 2021 to present including, without limitation, VMI's application for the grants or programs, releated award documents, and reports on all expendatures for the grants showing source of funds and what they were used for specifically (line item level). If there is a report of this in the SCHEV database, I am happy to review it first.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Grants and Programs
communications.communication: For additional Clarification, I want to be sure it is understood that this request covers, without limitation, the URP.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Grants and Programs
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Nash and Anonymous,

SCHEV is in receipt of your FOIA request dated June 2, 2025, related to VMI grants. Attached are all the records we have to date. Hope you have a great day.

Sincerely,

Laura B. Osberger
Director of Board & Executive Operations and Communications/FOIA Officer
State Council of Higher Education for Virginia
101 N. 14th Street, 10th floor
Richmond, VA 23219
(804) 786-2323 (work)
(804) 387-5191 (cell)
lauraosberger@schev.edu

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Grants and Programs
communications.communication: Thank you very much for the quick response and the information!  We have one question for clarification: do these represent every grant of any type with a connection to SCHEV VMI received, or do we not see any grants for SCHEV's Under-represented Population or DOI/SEI support programs? Are those separate areas from these, or is it that no such grants exist? Just want to be sure we are not missing a program!  Thank you again for your help.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Grants and Programs
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The attachments I sent represent the entirety of VMI grants received from SCHEV. No under-represented population or DOI/SEI support programs from SCHEV exist.

Sincerely,

Laura B. Osberger
Director of Board & Executive Operations and Communications/FOIA Officer
State Council of Higher Education for Virginia
101 N. 14th Street, 10th floor
Richmond, VA 23219
(804) 786-2323 (work)
(804) 387-5191 (cell)
lauraosberger@schev.edu

title: Medex (Wisconsin Department of Justice)

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Medex (Wisconsin Department of Justice)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports state that departments in you state have partnered with Medex, an AI company.

Therefore, I hereby request the following records:

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the use of Medex / Magnet Forensics. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discussed the use of Medex/Magnet Forensics, B) any explanations (whether internally or externally generated) of how Medex/Magnet Forensics works, and C) any other document that has been used to help explain the use of Medex/Magnet Forensics, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) A copy of any privacy impact assessments, use policies, technical explainers or assessments, standard operating procedures, data retention policies, legal opinions or assessments, warranties, non-disclosure agreements, contracts, liability waivers, insurance agreements, Requests for Proposals, Responses to Requests for Proposal, Memorandums of Understanding, Letters of Interest, usage policies, or informal agreements between the police department/this office and Medex/Magnet Forensics.

3) A copy of any funding opportunity announcements, grant applications and grantor status/progress reports, reports to legislative bodies, annual reports that mention Medex/Magnet Forensics, as well as audit records, including but not limited to security audits of the software, misuse reports, and reports to oversight bodies.

4) Any digital communications including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) that mention Medex/Magnet Forensics or sent to/from email addresses with the @medexforensics.com or @magnetforensics.com domains.

5) Any case reports in which Medex/Magnet Forensics was used.

6) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) with Medex/Magnet Forensics representatives.

Please try to include any other miscellaneous documents that facilitate this department's relationship with Medex/Magnet Forensics that don't neatly fall neatly into the above categories. Please search between January 1, 2023 and the time this request is published.

The requested documents will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent technology journalism website: www.404media.co

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Medex (Wisconsin Department of Justice)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The Wisconsin Department of Justice (DOJ) construes your correspondence as a public records request pursuant to the Wisconsin Public Records Law, Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31 to 19.39. We have initiated a review of our files in order to respond to your request.

Wisconsin Statutes mandate that we provide you with a response “as soon as practicable and without delay.” Wis. Stat. § 19.35(4)(a). DOJ is committed to providing a thorough and timely response to your request.

Thank you,

[cid:image001.png@01DB4703.48F98E30]
State of Wisconsin Department of Justice
Office of Open Government
17 W. Main Street
Madison, WI 53703
opengov@widoj.gov<mailto:opengov@widoj.gov>
Phone: (608) 267-2220

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Medex (Wisconsin Department of Justice)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon:

Thank you for your message. The Wisconsin Department of Justice (DOJ), DOJ construes your correspondence as a public records request pursuant to the Wisconsin Public Records Law, Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31 to 19.39. DOJ completed a search of its files and determined that it has records potentially responsive to your request. A review of those files to determine what records can be prepared for release to you continues.

Due to the high volume of public records requests received by DOJ, we are unable to provide an estimate on when we anticipate having a response to your request ready. Please rest assured that our office is working to process your request.

Wisconsin Statutes mandate that we provide you with a response “as soon as practicable and without delay.” Wis. Stat. § 19.35(4)(a). Please be assured that DOJ is committed to providing a thorough and timely response to your request. We appreciate your patience as we continue to process your request.

Thank you,

[cid:image001.png@01DBA94A.9C0CCC00]
State of Wisconsin Department of Justice
Office of Open Government
17 W. Main Street
Madison, WI 53703
opengov@widoj.gov<mailto:opengov@widoj.gov>
Phone: (608) 267-2220

title: Request to DEA for production assistance agreements between 2017 and 2023

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to DEA for production assistance agreements between 2017 and 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any production assistance agreements signed by the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) with any film or television productions, inclusive of the years 2017-2023.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: DEA FOIA/PA Case Number: 24-00589-F
communications.communication:
Dear Brett Carollo: This e-mail responds to your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request dated March 7, 2024, received by the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), FOIA/PA Unit, seeking access to DEA records.  Your request has been opened and assigned the following case number: 24-00589-F.  Please include this case number when communicating with this office. The records you seek require searches in another office or offices, and so your request falls within "unusual circumstances."  See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii).  Because of these unusual circumstances, we are extending the time limit to respond to your request beyond the ten additional days provided by the statute.  We have not yet completed a search to determine whether there are records within the scope of your request.  The time needed to process your request will necessarily depend on the complexity of our records search and on the volume and complexity of any records located.  For your information, this office assigns incoming requests to one of three tracks:  simple, complex, or expedited.  Each request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to other requests in the same track.  Simple requests usually receive a response in approximately one month, whereas complex requests take longer than a month to complete.  At this time, your request has been assigned to the complex track.  You may wish to narrow the scope of your request to limit the number of potentially responsive records or agree to an alternative time frame for processing, should records be located; or you may wish to await the completion of our records search to discuss either of these options. We regret the necessity of this delay, but please be assured that your request will be processed as soon as possible.  If you have any questions or wish to discuss reformulation or an alternative time frame for the processing of your request, you may contact our FOIA Requester Service Center at (571) 776-2300, or e-mail your correspondence to DEA.FOIA@dea.gov. In addition, you may wish to visit our website at www.dea.gov to determine if the information you are requesting is already available to the public.  You may contact our FOIA Public Liaison at (571) 776-2300 for any further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at (202) 741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at (202) 741-5769. Sincerely, 
FOIA/PA Unit FOIA & Information Law Section Office of Chief Counsel Drug Enforcement Administration 
PRIVACY ACT NOTICE:  This e-mail (including any attachments herein) may contain personal and privileged information that requires protection in compliance with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a).  Any use of this information by anyone other than the intended recipient is prohibited.  If you have received this communication in error, please immediately delete all copies of this information and notify me by e-mail.  The use, dissemination, distribution, or reproduction of this communication by unintended recipients is not authorized and may be unlawful.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-00589-F
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

This message pertains to FOIA request #24-00589-F. I wish to appeal the finding that the requested records are exempt from FOIA release. It does not seem reasonable that general information about official DEA collaborations with feature films or TV shows would meet the exemption requirements. 

If the appeal is rejected, I request (in order to help inform future FOIA requests with DEA) to know if DEA considers any and all information pertaining to collaborations between DEA and the entertainment industry exempt from FOIA.

Thank you.

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: DEA FOIA/PA Case Number: 25-00713-F
communications.communication:
Dear Brett Carollo: This e-mail responds to your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy Act (FOIA/PA) request dated December 31, 2024, received by the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), FOIA/PA Unit, seeking access to DEA records.  Your request has been opened and assigned the following case number: 25-00713-F.  Please include this case number when communicating with this office. The records you seek require searches in another office or offices, and so your request falls within "unusual circumstances."  See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii).  Because of these unusual circumstances, we are extending the time limit to respond to your request beyond the ten additional days provided by the statute.  We have not yet completed a search to determine whether there are records within the scope of your request.  The time needed to process your request will necessarily depend on the complexity of our records search and on the volume and complexity of any records located.  For your information, this office assigns incoming requests to one of three tracks:  simple, complex, or expedited.  Each request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to other requests in the same track.  Simple requests usually receive a response in approximately one month, whereas complex requests take longer than a month to complete.  At this time, your request has been assigned to the complex track. We regret the necessity of this delay, but please be assured that your request will be processed as soon as possible.  If you have any questions, you may contact our FOIA Requester Service Center at (571) 776-2300, or e-mail your correspondence to DEA.FOIA@dea.gov. In addition, you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison at (571) 776-2300 for any further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at (202) 741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at (202) 741-5769. Sincerely, 
FOIA/PA Unit FOIA & Information Law Section Office of Chief Counsel Drug Enforcement Administration 
PRIVACY ACT NOTICE:  This e-mail (including any attachments herein) may contain personal and privileged information that requires protection in compliance with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a).  Any use of this information by anyone other than the intended recipient is prohibited.  If you have received this communication in error, please immediately delete all copies of this information and notify me by e-mail.  The use, dissemination, distribution, or reproduction of this communication by unintended recipients is not authorized and may be unlawful.

title: Request to FBI for all 2024 movie collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to FBI for all 2024 movie collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the Federal Bureau of Investigation has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2024. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports, production assistance agreements, or similar internal documents. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices, public affairs offices, and communications HQ.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Public Records Request - HSMV

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - HSMV
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:

https://www.wfla.com/news/hillsborough-county/suspected-drunken-largo-woman-grabs-troopers-genitals-bites-leg-after-i-4-crash-fhp/


Exact date of incident: Sep 29, 2024

Names of parties involved: Tyshera Williams

Location: I-4 in Tampa


I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

Jimmy Tobias

communications.subject: EPA FOIA Public Access Link Invitation; Notice of Sending of System-Generated FOIAXpress Email Public Access Link Invitation to Create Requester Account
communications.communication:
To the U.S. EPA FOIA Requester Community,

Some in the EPA Requester community have encountered problems creating FOIAXpress Public Access Link (PAL) accounts in the Agency's new FOIA application FOIAXpress.   With the FOIAXpress application, the PAL is the best method for EPA to release voluminous records to our Requesters, without encountering MB-limiting firewalls and such transmission impediments.

The Agency is working diligently to solve this FOIAXpress issue.  In the interim, we have taken the step to "push" a system-generated invitation to create a PAL account to you.  You should receive an email from address noreply_nfo@epa.gov<mailto:noreply_nfo@epa.gov> with instructions on how to take the next steps to successfully establish the PAL account.

If you chose to establish this account, this would then ensure that all future interim and final responses from your FOIA requests to EPA will be available for download via the PAL.  It will also allow you to submit any new requests to U.S. EPA using your PAL account.
Regards,
Rebecca Clausen, on behalf of the
EPA FOIAXpress Implementation Team

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #EPA-R5-2023-006711
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

Per the correspondence sent on 2/15/2024, the due date for this request has been set to 5/31/2024.

As you may know, EPA has received numerous requests regarding the East Palestine Train Derailment, including requests that have been granted expedited processing which will be processed before your request. EPA has also made interim releases and released thousands of pages of records since February 2023, which can be found here: https://cumulis.epa.gov/supercpad/CurSites/cscdocument.cfm?id=0521908&doc=Y&colid=42384. EPA is still diligently working to process your request and appreciates your patience.

Please reach out if you have any additional questions.

Thank you,

Krishna Bhatt (She/Her)
Attorney-Advisor|National FOIA Office<https://www.epa.gov/foia/forms/contact-us-about-freedom-information-act-and-foia-requests>

1200 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W. (MC 2310A)
Washington, D.C. 20460

title: CD of Testimony Taken During US Navy Court of Inquiry into USS Liberty Attack

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CD of Testimony Taken During US Navy Court of Inquiry into USS Liberty Attack
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the IDF attacked our ship on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

In June, 1967 the US Navy convened a Court of Inquiry to look into the June 8, 1967 attack on the USS Liberty.

Testimony taken by the court was recorded on a Dictaphone which was later converted to CD.

I am requesting a copy of the CD that contains the testimony before the US Navy Court of Inquiry into the attack on the USS Liberty.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

title: Commonweath Equity Audity Quarterly Reports

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Commonweath Equity Audity Quarterly Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all Quarterly reports following the Commonwealth's Equity Audit for the Period July 1, 2021, to Present.

These reports were mandatory as a result of the Barnes and Thornburg Investigation.

According to the  "Quarterly Report 1 - Commonwealth's Equity Audit July 1, 2021 - December 15, 2021"   (Attached):  "VMI began submitting 'quarterly reports' to the BOV for follow-on submission to SCHEV and the
Virginia Military Institute and the General Assembly on 15 December 2021, and will continue this practice for the next three years."

These lawfully required documents must exist and should be readily available.

If VMI discontinued providing these mandatory reports at any time or failed to submit one or more of the required reports I request records showing who in the appropriate position of authority made the decision to stop reporting and the basis for that decision as well as the notificationsto the proper agencies and offices to which these mandatory reports were to be submitted (BOV, GA, SCHEV, etc.) as well as the associated approval to end or otherwise limit this mandatory requirement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: GA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Lumpkin County Election And Registration Office)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Lumpkin County Election And Registration Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the Dominion voting system. Forsyth County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report” at this link: https://www.forsythco.com/Departments-Offices/Voter-Registrations-Elections/Election-Results. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Cochise County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Cochise County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to all staff—both medical and correctional—related to handling or managing prisoners with blood borne pathogens including but not limited Hepatitis C or HIV/AIDS.  This could be in the form of training materials on how to quarantine individuals with blood borne pathogens, or training materials for correctional staff on what to do when coming into contact with someone who has a blood borne pathogen. 

2- Any emergency preparedness manuals, directives, or training materials for when a viral outbreak occurs (this could also be referred to as a “pandemic procedure".)

3- Any medical directives, memos, regulations, or staff training around prescribing the medical protocol of PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis).

4- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to staff on housing criteria for specific populations (e.g. women, youth, those with illnesses, etc.)

5- Employee handbook given to correctional staff upon hiring, as well as any employee handbook given separately to medical staff

I am also requesting the following data and forms:

1- Aggregate data by month on the number of prisoners with HIV and Hep C for the last two years. If this data exists only in a format that requires creation of a new record, please provide the data in its original format and remove identifying information.

2- A copy of the standard medical intake form used for prisoners or people held inside the facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Joseph Darius Jaafari

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Nevada Department of Corrections)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma
